definition[0]: a savings plan in the US, used mainly by people who work for themselves rather than for an employer. Keoghs provide the person with a PENSION (=income after they have stopped working)
example[0]: You can put money in a Keogh even if you are already covered by a corporate pension or profit-sharing plan.
example[1]: These days, Keogh plans are of increased interest for executives who have lost their jobs.
